title: Garmin (GRMN) Receives Media Impact Score of 0.03
content: Media headlines about Garmin (NASDAQ:GRMN) have trended somewhat positive recently, Accern reports. The research firm identifies positive and negative news coverage by analyzing more than 20 million blog and news sources in real time. Accern ranks coverage of companies on a scale of negative one to positive one, with scores nearest to one being the most favorable. Garmin earned a daily sentiment score of 0.03 on Accern’s scale. Accern also assigned media stories about the scientific and technical instruments company an impact score of 44.2550853115441 out of 100, indicating that recent news coverage is somewhat unlikely to have an impact on the stock’s share price in the next few days.    These are some of the news stories that may have effected Accern’s scoring:    Get Garmin alerts:     $0.87 EPS Expected for Garmin Ltd. (GRMN) This Quarter (americanbankingnews.com)  Garmin Ltd. (GRMN) Insider Min H. Kao Sells 100,000 Shares (americanbankingnews.com)  Save 20% on Garmin Forerunner 35 Watch (Certified Refurbished) (cnet.com)  Garmin introduces integrated flight deck to turbine helicopter market (financial-news.co.uk)  Garmin (GRMN) Down 1.7% Since Earnings Report: Can It Rebound? (finance.yahoo.com)   GRMN has been the topic of several recent research reports. Credit Suisse Group  reiterated a “hold” rating on shares of Garmin in a research report on Thursday, February 22nd. Robert W. Baird  reiterated a “neutral” rating and issued a $60.00 price objective (up from $57.00) on shares of Garmin in a research report on Thursday, February 22nd. BidaskClub upgraded shares of Garmin from a “hold” rating to a “buy” rating in a report on Thursday, February 8th. Tigress Financial  restated a “buy” rating on shares of Garmin in a report on Monday, March 12th. Finally, Zacks Investment Research lowered shares of Garmin from a “buy” rating to a “hold” rating in a report on Friday, March 23rd. Seven investment analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and three have assigned  a buy rating to the company. The company currently has an average rating of “Hold” and a consensus price target of $60.40.      Shares of Garmin traded up $1.30, hitting $61.39, during trading hours on Friday, Marketbeat reports. 974,750 shares of the company were exchanged, compared to its average volume of 1,072,315. The firm has a market cap of $11.48 billion, a P/E ratio of 20.88, a PEG ratio of 2.33 and a beta of 0.98. Garmin has a 1 year low of $49.80 and a 1 year high of $65.96.    Garmin (NASDAQ:GRMN) last issued its quarterly earnings data on Wednesday, May 2nd. The scientific and technical instruments company reported $0.68 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, beating the Thomson Reuters’ consensus estimate of $0.56 by $0.12. Garmin had a net margin of 18.57% and a return on equity of 15.66%. The company had revenue of $711.00 million during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $670.71 million. During the same quarter last year, the company earned $0.52 earnings per share. Garmin’s revenue for the quarter was up 10.9% on a year-over-year basis.  equities analysts expect that  Garmin will post 3.13 earnings per share for the current year.    In related news, insider Pao-Chang Huang sold 4,800 shares of the firm’s stock in a transaction on Thursday, March 15th. The stock was sold at an average price of $60.37, for a total transaction of $289,776.00. The sale was disclosed in a legal filing with the SEC, which can be accessed through the SEC website . Also, insider Min H. Kao sold 100,000 shares of the firm’s stock in a transaction on Friday, June 1st. The stock was sold at an average price of $61.03, for a total value of $6,103,000.00. The disclosure for this sale can be found here . Over the last quarter, insiders have sold 3,008,574 shares of company stock valued at $180,022,888. Company insiders own  17.85% of the company’s stock.    Garmin Company Profile    Garmin Ltd. designs, develops, manufactures, markets, and distributes a range of navigation, communication, and information devices worldwide. It operates through five segments: Auto, Aviation, Marine, Outdoor, and Fitness. The Auto segment offers personal navigation devices; infotainment systems; and action cameras, as well as mobile applications under the Garmin and NAVIGON names.
